field.name: description
field.value:
Given the following XML configuration:
{code lang=xml} <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <facilities> <facility id="event.wiring" type="Castle.Facilities.EventWiring.EventWiringFacility, Castle.Windsor" /> </facilities> <components> <component id="fooRepository" service="Acme.Crm.IFooRepository, Acme.Crm" type="Acme.Crm.FooRepository, Acme.Crm" lifestyle="custom" customLifestyleType="Acme.Crm.FooCustomLifestyle"> </component> </components> </configuration> {code}
The following things could be safely removed and replaced by defaults:
* facility id - if type is provided, the type should be the id (like it is when we register from code) * component id - if type is provided, the type should be the id (like it is when we register from code) * lifestyle - if no lifestyle is provided but {{customLifestyleType}} is specified, custom lifestyle with the type provided should be used

comment.author: jsimons
comment.text: Krzysztof, are you saying you want to remove facility id and component id, or are you saying they should be optional?

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text: Make them optional. I want to avoid breaking changes where they don't really make sense

comment.author: jsimons
comment.text: I may be wrong here but isn't it safe to remove the facility id? What is it used for?

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text: I'm not planning to remove it. I want to make it optional. It is used to look up facilities. I want to change how that's done so the type would be used primarily for that. That would also enforce you can only have a single instance of a facility in the container.
